data.title: Fiction winners
data.meta_description: Past winners of the James Tait Black Prize for Fiction, listed by year of publication.
data.text:
Winners of the James Tait Black Prize for Fiction.

Please note these are listed by year of publication.

2020-present

Alexis Wright - Praiseworthy (And Other Stories) - 2023

Barbara Kingsolver - Demon Copperhead (Faber) - 2022

Keith Ridgway - A Shock (Picador) - 2021

Shola von Reinhold - Lote (Jacaranda) - 2020

2010–2019

Lucy Ellmann - Ducks, Newburyport (Galley Beggar Press) - 2019

Olivia Laing - Crudo (Picador) - 2018

Eley Williams - Attrib. and Other Stories (Influx Press) - 2017

Eimear McBride - The Lesser Bohemians (Faber and Faber) 2016

Benjamin Markovits - You Don’t Have to Live Like This (Faber and Faber) - 2015

Zia Haider Rahman - In the Light of What We Know (Picador) - 2014

Jim Crace - Harvest (Picador) - 2013

Alan Warner - The Deadman’s Pedal (Jonathan Cape) - 2012

Padgett Powell - You and I (Serpent's Tail) - 2011

Tatjani Soli - The Lotus Eaters (St Martin's Press) - 2010

2000–2009

A S Byatt - The Children's Book (Chatto & Windus) - 2009

Sebastian Barry - The Secret Scripture (Faber and Faber) - 2008

Rosalind Belben - Our Horses in Egypt (Chatto & Windus) - 2007

Cormac McCarthy - The Road (Picador) - 2006

Ian McEwan - Saturday (Jonathan Cape) - 2005

David Peace - GB84 (Faber) - 2004

Andrew O'Hagan - Personality (Faber) - 2003

Jonathan Franzen - The Corrections (Fourth Estate) - 2002

Sid Smith - Something Like a House (Picador) - 2001

Zadie Smith - White Teeth (Penguin UK) - 2000

1990–1999

Timothy Mo - Renegade or Halo2 (Paddleless Press) - 1999

Beryl Bainbridge - Master Georgie (Duckworth) - 1998

Andrew Miller - Ingenious Pain (Sceptre) - 1997

Joint Award: Graham Swift - Last Orders (Picador Macmillan) and Alice Thompson - Justine (Canongate) - 1996

Christopher Priest - The Prestige (Touchstone) - 1995

Alan Hollinghurst - The Folding Star (Chatto & Windus) - 1994

Caryl Phillips - Crossing The River (Bloomsbury) - 1993

Rose Tremain - Sacred Country (Sinclair Stevenson) - 1992

Iain Sinclair - Downriver (Michael Joseph) - 1991

William Boyd - Brazzaville Beach (Sinclair Stevenson) - 1990

1980–1989

James Kelman - A Disaffection (Secker & Warburg) - 1989

Piers Paul Read - A Season In The West (Secker & Warburg) - 1988

George Mackay Brown - The Golden Bird: Two Orkney Stories (John Murray) - 1987

Jenny Joseph - Persephone (Bloodaxe Books) - 1986

Robert Edric - Winter Garden (André Deutsch) - 1985

Joint Award: J. G. Ballard - Empire Of The Sun (Gollancz) and Angela Carter - Nights At The Circus (Chatto & Windus) - 1984

Jonathan Keates - Allegro Postillions (Salamander Press) - 1983

Bruce Chatwin - On The Black Hill (Cape) - 1982

Joint Award: Salman Rushdie - Midnight's Children (Cape) and Paul Theroux - The Mosquito Coast (Hamish Hamilton) - 1981

J. M. Coetzee - Waiting For The Barbarians (Secker & Warburg) - 1980

1970–1979

William Golding - Darkness Visible (Faber) - 1979

Maurice Gee - Plumb (Faber) - 1978

John Le Carré - The Honourable Schoolboy (Hodder & Stoughton) - 1977

John Banville - Doctor Copernicus (Secker & Warburg) - 1976

Brian Moore - The Great Victorian Collection (Cape) - 1975

Lawrence Durrell - Monsieur, Or The Prince Of Darkness - 1974

Iris Murdoch - The Black Prince - 1973

John Berger - G - 1972

Nadine Gordimer - A Guest Of Honour - 1971

Lily Powell - The Bird Of Paradise - 1970

1960–1969

Elizabeth Bowen - Eva Trout - 1969

Maggie Ross - The Gasteropod - 1968

Margaret Drabble - Jerusalem The Golden - 1967

Joint Award: Christine Brooke-Rose - Such and Aidan Higgins - Langrishe, Go Down - 1966

Muriel Spark - The Mandelbaum Gate - 1965

Frank Tuohy - The Ice Saints - 1964

Gerda Charles - A Slanting Light - 1963

Ronald Hardy - Act Of Destruction - 1962

Jennifer Dawson - The Ha-Ha - 1961

Rex Warner - Imperial Caesar - 1960

1950–1959

Morris West - The Devil's Advocate - 1959

Angus Wilson - The Middle Age Of Mrs Eliot - 1958

Anthony Powell - At Lady Molly's - 1957

Rose Macauley - The Towers Of Trebizond - 1956

Ivy Compton-Burnett - Mother And Son - 1955

C. P. Snow - The New Men and The Masters in sequence - 1954

Margaret Kennedy - Troy Chimneys - 1953

Evelyn Waugh - Men At Arms - 1952

W. C. Chapman-Mortimer - Father Goose - 1951

Robert Henriquez - Along The Valley - 1950

1940–1949

Emma Smith - The Far Cry - 1949

Graham Greene - The Heart Of The Matter - 1948

L. P. Hartley - Eustace And Hilda - 1947

G. Oliver Onions - Poor Man's Tapestry - 1946

L. A. G. Strong - Travellers - 1945

Forrest Reid - Young Tom - 1944

Mary Lavin - Tales From Bective Bridge - 1943

Arthur Whaley - Monkey By Wu Ch'eng-en - 1942

Joyce Cary - A House Of Children - 1941

Charles Morgan - The Voyage - 1940

1930–1939

Aldous Huxley - After Many A Summer Dies The Swan - 1939

C. S. Forester - A Ship Of The Line and Flying Colours - 1938

Neil M. Gunn - Highland River - 1937

Winifred Holtby - South Riding - 1936

L. H. Myers - The Root And The Flower - 1935

Robert Graves - I, Claudius and Claudius The God - 1934

A. G. Macdonell - England, Their England - 1933

Helen Simpson - Boomerang - 1932

Kate O'Brien - Without My Cloak - 1931

E. H. Young - Miss Mole - 1930

1919–1929

J. B. Priestley - The Good Companions - 1929

Siegfried Sassoon - Memoirs Of A Fox-Hunting Man - 1928

Francis Brett Young - Portrait Of Clare - 1927

Radclyffe Hall - Adam's Breed - 1926

Liam O'Flaherty - The Informer - 1925

E. M. Forster - A Passage To India - 1924

Arnold Bennett - Riceyman Steps - 1923

David Garnett - Lady Into Fox - 1922

Walter de la Mare - Memoirs Of A Midget - 1921

D. H. Lawrence - The Lost Girl - 1920

Hugh Walpole - The Secret City - 1919
